dmca.title: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Cliff Harris [mailto:cliff@positech.co.uk] 
Sent: Thursday, April 12, 2007 2:58 PM
To: Copyright
Subject: Re: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers
Importance: High

SEE ATTACHED DOCUMENT

plus in this email:

===========================================================

DMCA Removal Request


From:

Positech Games
Legal@positech.co.uk

To:

ThePlanet.com Internet services
1333 Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110, Dallas TX 75207


Monday, 09 April 2007


Identification of Copyrighted Work:
The PC game 'Kudos' for sale at www.kudosgame.com, IP owned by Positech 
Games

Identification of infringing work:
'Keygen' software used to bypass the digital Rights Management used on
the 
game to prevent unauthorised use.
http://ozcanhome.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=62&hl=dropzone
plus numerous other posts on the forum which also link to pirated copies
of 
our game 'Kudos'.

A look at the posts on the ozcanhome forums should make it immediately 
obvious this forum exists purely to trade copyrighted software. This is 
obvious, and apparent, and I'm sure you already know it.

Information to contact complaining party:

Legal@positech.co.uk
(+44)1276 479399
Positech Games, 229 Guildford Road Lightwater Surrey GU18 5RE

I have good faith belief that the use of the material in this manner 
complained of is not authorised by the copyright holder (Me) and I state

that this information is accurate, and under penalty of perjury that I
am 
authorised to act on the authority of the copyright holder, which is Me.



Electronic Signature:

\C.P.Harris\

===========================================================

Any problems with this????????????????????/
If so, EXPLAIN WHAT.

Cliff Harris
Positech Games
www.positech.co.uk
----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Copyright" <copyright@theplanet.com>
To: "Cliff Harris" <cliff@positech.co.uk>
Sent: Thursday, April 12, 2007 8:46 PM
Subject: RE: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers


To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf

Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Cliff Harris [mailto:cliff@positech.co.uk]
Sent: Thursday, April 12, 2007 5:24 AM
To: Copyright
Cc: Legal
Subject: Re: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers

A DMCA request has been sent to you, yet no action has been taken. Why?
And
is it normal for copyright infringement replies to be copied to
chillingeffects.org?
Failure to take action where a DMCA request has been filled out is not a

trivial matter.

Cliff Harris
Positech Games
www.positech.co.uk
----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Cliff Harris" <cliff@positech.co.uk>
To: "Copyright" <copyright@theplanet.com>
Sent: Monday, April 09, 2007 4:12 PM
Subject: Re: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers


> Fine. See attached.
> The entire forum is a warez forum. How is this even a matter of any
> dispute?
> Your own terms of service make claims to deal with such activities.If
the
> forum is left in place, please explain why you do not consider it in
> breach
> of your own terms of service, not to mention, the law.
>
> Cliff Harris
> Positech Games
> www.positech.co.uk
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: "Copyright" <copyright@theplanet.com>
> To: "Cliff Harris" <cliff@positech.co.uk>
> Cc: <Theplanet@chillingeffects.org>
> Sent: Monday, April 09, 2007 3:46 PM
> Subject: RE: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers
>
>
> To Whom It May Concern:
>
> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does
not
> substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
> Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
>
> Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
> claim.
>
> Please visit our web site at
>
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
> nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
>
> Legal Response Team
> THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cliff Harris [mailto:cliff@positech.co.uk]
> Sent: Friday, April 06, 2007 4:09 PM
> To: Copyright
> Subject: Re: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers
> Importance: High
>
> Please explain if this servers content has been examined, and if you
are
> in
> agreement that it is in breach of your terms of service, the website
is
> still running, and still distributing illegal copyrighted software,
and
> is
> now doing so with your knowledge.
>
> Cliff Harris
> Positech Games
> www.positech.co.uk
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: "Copyright" <copyright@theplanet.com>
> To: "Cliff Harris" <cliff@positech.co.uk>
> Sent: Wednesday, April 04, 2007 3:55 PM
> Subject: RE: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers
>
>
> Please note that the IP address 70.85.189.18 is within our network as
of
> 9:55:25 a.m. (GMT-6) on April 4, 2007.
>
> Legal Response Team
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cliff Harris [mailto:cliff@positech.co.uk]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 04, 2007 2:46 AM
> To: Copyright
> Subject: Tracing a warez forum to the planet servers
>
> Hi, could you please confirm that this IP address:
>
>                    70.85.189.18
>
> Is one of yours?
> It hosts the following site:
> www.ozcanhome.com, a forum for trading copyrighted applications,
movies,
>
> games and other content, including copyrighted PC games for which my
> company
> is the IP holder.
> They are clearly in breach of any TOS, could you confirm this is an
> account
> with your company, and let me know if any more information is
required?
> (2
> seconds looking at the site will tell you all you need to know).
>
> Cliff Harris
> Positech Games
> www.positech.co.uk
>
